text: I do not recommend. He does not provide any specific information about the patient's health condition; you have to guess everything. Throughout the entire hospital stay of my loved one, he did not even spare me, as the closest family member of the patient, 5 minutes for a conversation. On top of that, there was an unsuccessful aneurysm surgery. Unfortunately, I have very bad memories after contact with this doctor. Dr. Pałka does not know what empathy is, at least that was the case in my situation.

I was not satisfied with the visit, it was all about commerce - 'next please' - I expected interest in the problem. The doctor's opinion regarding the surgical procedure. I asked about laser surgery - and I found out that every surgery is just as good as these 'so modern' ones. I guess they don't perform laser surgery in Wrocław, so in this case I am not a 'good' patient.

Unfortunately, the lady doctor may be very nice, but she cannot read an ultrasound image. She performed an ultrasound on me twice, having information from me that the previous doctor had seen a tumor. Pani Agnieszka Zaleska - Gajek assured me twice that my adnexa were unchanged and that the problem should be looked for in the intestines. However, the CT scan results clearly showed that I had an ovarian teratoma tumor (one of them even 9 cm long). The tumors were coming out of the ovaries, the lady doctor did not see them, which very much surprised the gynecologists I later went to in order to have these tumors removed.

I went to Pan Doktor after several visits to another gynecologist who did not suit me. After - so far - two visits, I am convinced that I want to have my pregnancy monitored by Pan Doktor; I may not be a complicated case, the pregnancy is proceeding normally so far, but it is very important to me that Pan Doktor devotes enough time to me during the visit, analyzes test results in detail, answers all questions, and simply inspires my trust. And the visits took place at the scheduled time, which is also a plus!

I was operated on in 1996 by Pan (then) doc. Andrzej Marchel (now Prof.). A difficult operation to remove a brain hemangioma, it lasted about 6-7 hours. Thanks to Pan Marchel, I am alive to this day, without epileptic seizures. An excellent and superb doctor. (Now to the 'statement' by Kar77) A doctor is there to take care of the patient, not his family, and I am not surprised that one has to wait for an audience with Pan Marchel... sometimes much longer than half a day because a specialist of this class is a very busy man and deals primarily with the good of the patient, not his family. I am glad that Andrzej Marchel is a professor because if there is anyone who deserves this title, it is undoubtedly him.

My partner and I went to Pani doktor Lisowska - Kani. First of all, we waited for hours in front of the office because she mixed up the hours. Secondly, the meeting lasted about 35 minutes but she charged for a full hour. Unfortunately, she was not able to help us with our problem, although we thought it was not serious. We got absolutely nothing out of the visit to Pani doktor.

The doctor is very approachable and polite. During the visit, he examined me and was very sure of his diagnosis. He prescribed a bunch of medications and said they would definitely help - unfortunately, neither the diagnosis nor the prescribed medications brought the intended effect. Additionally, for acute knee pain, he didn't even refer me for an ultrasound...

It's hard for me to say what kind of pediatrician he is, but as an internist he didn't shine in my case. I came with an untreated cold; although I had taken an antibiotic earlier, unfortunately I didn't get rid of the runny nose. The doctor said that with a runny nose it happens, that it lasts for weeks.... I asked for 2-3 days off to recover (2 weeks of illness had weakened me a lot and I could barely stand), unfortunately I was told that there was no such need :/ instead I got a whole list of symptom relievers like Nurofen, Sudafed, etc. If after 2 weeks of a severe cold, a persistent runny nose despite taking an antibiotic, the doctor prescribes Sudafed, then something is probably wrong....

Research from the National Institute of Public Health - National Institute of Hygiene (IŻŻ) shows that butter available on the Polish market contains from about 2 to about 3 percent trans fatty acids. "In dairy products from ruminant animals, such as cows, sheep, they cannot be eliminated. Their content in butter changes depending on the feed used for supplementation throughout the year and can range from 1 to 8 percent." - explains prof. Mojska. Larger amounts of trans isomers were found in so-called fat blends, i.e., those in which various types of fats are used, both of plant and animal origin (this can be a mixture of butter with vegetable oils or margarine with the addition of milk).

In some parts of the world, fermented food is very popular, diverse, and valued for its good effect on the body. In others, on the other hand, it is considered harmful, tasteless, and unfit for consumption. In Asia, products fermented in brine (e.g., kimchi) and fruit and vegetable pickles (e.g., wasabi) are very popular. Fruit juices and dried vegetables are also subjected to this process. It is similar in Africa, where besides vegetable and fruit pickles, various kinds of vinegars and chili sauces, a very popular dish is fermented grains. In South America, pickled vegetables and fruits, fermented grains, as well as wines and other alcoholic beverages, such as agave syrup, are still eagerly consumed.

Do you know where the lady doctor practices as an allergist, because when I called the clinic in Aldemed, a not very helpful receptionist said that the doctor practices only and exclusively as a pulmonologist, they did not want to connect me with the lady doctor and refused any information. Does anyone know more about this? I would be grateful.

Women, don't you even think about going for a visit to this man! I remember how 6 years ago, when he was still working at the Andrology Clinic in the Hospital on Staszica Street, he passed off to another doctor (after his own examination) a patient with a pregnancy that had died some time ago (of course, saying nothing to either the patient or the doctor). What a specialist! If it's good, it's him, and if something is wrong, it's on someone else's account! (this info is first-hand). And the worst thing is that this man now works next to Pan Dr. A. Wdowiak - a super doctor, a specialist!!!

I also recommend Pani Elżbieta, a very nice and competent person. The nutrition plan prepared by the lady dietitian was tailored to my lifestyle, and all the dishes were interesting, tasty, and above all, wholesome. I managed to lose weight and develop a habit of healthy and regular eating. I am satisfied, I highly recommend.

Krzysztof is an EXCELLENT physiotherapist! I came to him with a dislocating, crooked knee, after ligament surgery, and with a painful meniscus in the other knee. Krzysztof, after a general interview and examination, quickly determined what could help with this and how to counteract it. His knowledge + intensive exercise sets, commitment, and willingness work 'miracles'! He opened my eyes that this, that, and that doesn't work and doesn't function normally, which is why such and such things happen. Now my work and training have finally become pure pleasure and not a struggle with myself! :) I RECOMMEND! To finish, I will add that after a few visits I brought my mother, who for 9 months had been struggling with sharp shoulder pain, visiting various specialists, doctors during this period, paying a fortune. Moreover, no one helped her even a bit during this time, and every day she took 2-3 painkillers for the pain. After the visit to Krzysiek, it turned out that she had torn tendons. And after his first, 3-hour, very painful visit and massages, she made it to the next visit only with bruises, but already WITHOUT painkillers! :) Krzysiek is truly a SPECIALIST WORTH RECOMMENDING. Especially if you want to be treated naturally, without unnecessary pills and in a cheerful atmosphere! :)

I do not recommend. Pan doktor disregards patients. He is unprofessional. Today I was at his center, LIM. The lady at the reception announced that the doctor was running a little late (15 minutes), but he still managed to catch up. Two patients before me were with him for a total of 10 minutes, and I entered 5 minutes before my scheduled time. During the visit, the doctor did not take me seriously, let alone my problems. He was not very factual, stated generally that my problems were the result of stress, and as medicine I received a leaflet that such an outstanding specialist recommended I read at home. I will only add that I waited 1.5 months for this visit.

The lady doctor during the visit at the night medical help service was dismissive, very unpleasant, and arrogant. I understand it was Saturday evening, when I arrived at the hospital the lady doctor together with the lady from registration were sipping coffee and gossiping. There were no patients at all, and I had to wait 15 minutes before she moved and admitted me. When I entered the office, she decided that I had come unnecessarily (and I had a terribly dry cough because of which I couldn't breathe, a fever, and blocked sinuses) She barely examined me, prescribed medications, and that was it. She didn't even tell me what was wrong with me. I do not recommend this Pani Doktor, she does not care about the well-being of her patients at all.

Flax seeds, like soybean, rapeseed, and sunflower seeds, contain large amounts of fat, which is available on the shelves of health food stores in the form of flaxseed oil. "This oil is the richest source of alpha-linolenic fatty acid. This acid, which is classified in the omega-3 group, is attributed multifaceted biological activity. It participates in regulating blood sugar levels, has a beneficial effect on eyesight, raises concentration abilities, increases the body's resistance to stress" - emphasized prof. Amarowicz. He added that athletes practicing strength and endurance disciplines are recommended to consume alpha-linolenic acid in order to increase lean body mass. This compound also influences muscle strength growth and raises the body's aerobic capacity.

I am satisfied with the visits to Pani Ewa, this is already my next visit, she is a nice person, the treatment regarding my problem is bringing results, earlier I was treated by five other doctors, but the problem quickly repeated after treatment, for now a year has passed since the first visit and not jinxing it :) it is better...

I was at this lady doctor about a year ago with a problem of the image blurring in my eye. At the visit, for which I had to wait about an hour longer than planned (well, it happens), I found out that my eyesight is perfectly fine (I paid over 100 PLN), there is just something at the back of the eye. Two weeks later I went for a visit to another doctor (where I had to pay again), because it didn't give me peace, and it turned out that I simply have astigmatism, which was confirmed by yet another ophthalmologist because I was confused by two 'diagnoses'. If it weren't for the fact that I am looking for an ophthalmologist for routine check-up and accidentally ended up here again, I probably wouldn't even write this review. I have no other remarks for the lady doctor, I do not diminish her knowledge, experience, or likability, however I was disappointed.

In common belief, green tea is very beneficial for health and is also a drink recommended during diets. In earlier research, prof. Walkowiak and his team established that green tea also limits the absorption of fats. Do the new studies mean that it is beneficial for people fighting overweight? The professor cautions against drawing such conclusions hastily. "Theoretically, we are dealing here with a situation where one could limit or slow down the absorption of sugar from starch, and thus prevent hyperglycemia or excessive sugar uptake" - he said in an interview with PAP. Potentially, this means 'some chance in the context of problems with obesity, which today has pandemic proportions' - he added.
